intro: Senecio mongolicus, commonly known as Mongolian groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Mongolia and northern China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often on rocky soils, and is well adapted to harsh climatic conditions. It produces small yellow flowers that are surrounded by pale green or white ray florets. Senecio mongolicus is often found in steppe and desert regions, where it plays a minor role in local ecosystems.
